intro: Blepharis drummondii, commonly known as the Drummond's beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The flowers are typically pink to purple in color and bloom during the spring and early summer. This plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It is well adapted to drought conditions and is considered a hardy, low-maintenance plant for xeriscaping.
